;美国总统乔·拜登不太可能出席下个月在雅加达与东南亚领导人举行的峰会多位消息人士称，他的缺席将引发人们对美国对这一地区的承诺的质疑，该地区对于遏制中国不断扩大的影响力至关重要。

;

;拜登将于 9 月 9 日至 10 日在印度出席 G20 峰会并于周二表示，他计划“很快”访问重要的新兴东南亚伙伴越南，以升级关系，但他能否出席 9 月 4 日至 7 日举行的东南亚国家联盟 (ASEAN) 10 国峰会存在重大疑问。

;

;一位知情人士称，拜登不会前往印度尼西亚，另一位消息人士援引一位东盟成员国驻华盛顿大使的话称，印度尼西亚已于周一获悉拜登不会前往。其他消息来源援引白宫官员的话说，拜登出席“不太可能”。

;

;当被问及拜登不会前往印度尼西亚是否正确时，一位白宫高级官员周二表示：“我们仍在努力……我们可能很快就会有更多消息。”

;

;白宫发言人没有立即回应置评请求。消息人士称，拜登的亚洲日程在宣布之前尚未正式公布，并且可能会发生变化。

;

;为什么美国对东南亚的看法必须超越与中国的激烈竞争

;

;几位东盟外交官表示，鉴于拜登政府公开强调与该地区关系的重要性，如果拜登不前往雅加达，那将令人非常失望。

;

;一位高级外交官提到印度尼西亚已经安排了东盟峰会，通常在 11 月举行，9 月举行，专门是为了让拜登有可能出席并继续参加 G20。

;

;消息人士称，预计拜登将派副总统卡马拉·哈里斯接替他的位置。哈里斯是第一位亚裔美国副总统，此前曾在该地区开展过外交活动。

;

;拜登取消了在任美国总统首次访问巴布亚的行程，这已经引起了该地区的失望。 5 月前往新几内亚，随后计划访问澳大利亚，因为他正在努力与立法者达成协议以解决美国债务上限危机。

;

;周二晚上在华盛顿举行的东盟相关活动上发表讲话拜登的副国家安全顾问乔纳森·费纳 (Jonathan Finer) 对美国与东盟的关系表示赞赏，并表示“东盟中心地位”是政府印太地区战略的核心。

;

;政策分析人士表示，又一个缺席者拜登于 11 月在柬埔寨参加了东盟会议，他对这种描述提出了质疑。

;

;“这将被视为该地区的又一次失望，”东南部高级研究员默里·希伯特 (Murray Hiebert) 表示。华盛顿战略与国际研究中心的亚洲项目。

;

;“东南亚对拜登领导下的华盛顿加强与该地区的接触印象深刻，”希伯特说。

;

;“对他来说当他已经在附近参加印度峰会并可能对越南进行正式访问时却跳过峰会，这将促使该地区许多人怀疑美国是否会再次回到与美国的断断续续、半心半意的接触状态。 ”

;

;东盟正在成为中国贸易的替代方案，但不会成为替代品：专家

;

;前美国驻越南大使、美国-东盟商业委员会主席特德·奥修斯 (Ted Osius)，表示，如果拜登无法前往雅加达，可能会有些失望，尽管他强调在民主党人拜登的领导下，美国政府与东盟的接触“急剧”增加。

;

;东盟成员国对拜登的共和党前任唐纳德·特朗普连续三年缺席地区峰会感到不满，政策专家认为这有利于中国扩大其在该地区的影响力。

;

;特朗普的前任巴拉克·奥巴马出席了每次美国-东盟和东亚峰会2011 年的峰会除外，2013 年他因国内政府关闭而取消了峰会。

;中国女性使用假肚脐、假胸、假臀的新趋势兴起大陆社交媒体上对身体形象问题的担忧。

;

;最新出现的假身体部位是假肚脐。据新闻媒体 City Link 报道，与临时纹身类似，将不干胶贴纸贴在肚子上，距离实际肚脐上方几厘米处，肚脐被遮住，创造出双腿更长的错觉，被广泛认为更具吸引力。

;<根据该店的在线销售数据，在中国最大的在线购物平台之一拼多多上，最畅销的商家以不到 4 元（55 美分）的价格提供两张 32 片肚脐贴，并已收到 4,400 个订单。

;

;这张贴纸在社交媒体平台小红书上深受女性欢迎。

;

;“每年夏天，我总是感到烦恼。我真的很想穿时尚性感的衣服，但我的体型阻碍了我——它们穿在我身上不好看，而且我缺乏自信，”一位女士说道。

;

;“然而，这些贴纸不容易脱落；它们不反光，甚至防水。我愿意称它们为2023年最成功的发明！”

;

;在抖音上，另一位女士宣称：“这不仅仅是一个假肚脐贴；这是一个假肚脐贴。”这是告别我50-50身材比例的“作弊工具”。”

;

;很多人还分享了让贴纸看起来更真实的技巧，例如使用化妆粉将贴纸与周围融合肤色。

;

;假肚脐贴并不是唯一在中国社交媒体上流行的美容工具；假胸、假臀、假肩、假锁骨，甚至假鼻子现在都可以在网上买到。

;

;假臀据说可以使人的背部看起来更上提，增强身体的自然曲线，而假肩则可以让窄肩看起来更宽，打造出目前网络时尚、美容圈流行的“直角肩”造型。

;

;然而，新一代假体部位粉丝在网上热议的背后，却存在着一些担忧有人提出，它们还可能加剧一些女性对外表的焦虑。

;

;“我想知道这些女性在去掉假肚脐贴、胸垫、臀垫、一位在线评论家评论道。

;

;时尚和人际关系影响者，广为人知的南小姐，在微博上拥有超过 200 万粉丝，她表示，对于许多女性来说，这些产品使当他们以多年来美容应用程序的方式在网上展示自己时，他们会感到自信。

;

;“这些产品的功能越多，它们就越受欢迎。这里的潜在心理很难被忽视，现实是美丽在人们的生活中占有重要地位。”她说。

;

;为了回应对与外表相关的焦虑和使用这些产品的担忧，南小姐说大多数女性都会经历她所谓的“成长”过程，随着年龄的增长，变得更加成熟，不再那么看重外表。

;

;“外表美带来的喜悦和赞美是无法抗拒的但随着年龄的增长，即使是最先进的美容技术也无法抗拒时间。女性肯定会找到其他幸福源泉。”她说。

;周二，印度尼西亚最高法院对一名杀害助手的警察改判死刑这一决定在该国引起了怀疑，并引发了对法律程序透明度的质疑。

;

;前两星将军、印度尼西亚内政部部长费迪·桑博 (Ferdy Sambo) 被判犯有预谋罪去年 7 月，桑博的保镖 27 岁的准将诺弗里安夏·约苏亚·胡塔巴拉特 (Nofriansyah Yosua Hutabarat) 在桑博位于雅加达的家中被枪杀，此案引起了全国关注，随后的审判被广泛视为一次考验。警方问责制。

;

;Sambo 在二月份被判处最高刑罚，这项裁决被广泛视为 Hutabarat 及其家人获得正义的标志。但最高法院周二决定在上诉后将桑博的刑期减为终身监禁，这导致许多人在社交媒体上表达了他们的失望。

;

;维多多敦促“透明”调查，因为谋杀案动摇了对印度尼西亚警方的信心< /h3>;

;棉兰圣托马斯天主教大学刑法讲师贝尔利安·西玛玛塔 (Berlian Simarmata) 表示，虽然这一决定不是人们想听到的，但它“仍然在法律的范围内”，并受到政府的授权。

;

;“从法律上讲，最高法院的判决没有任何问题，但实质上人们会对判决有不同的看法，”他说。

;

;他补充说，根据根据印度尼西亚将于 2026 年分阶段实施的新《刑法》，桑博在服刑至少 15 年之后，将能够申请将其无期徒刑减为 20 年，这意味着他很可能有资格在印尼刑满释放。

;

;最高法院还减轻了 Sambo 同案被告的刑期，将其妻子 Putri Candrawathi 的 20 年监禁减半。她的助手 Kuat Ma'ruf 的刑期从 15 年减至 10 年，警官 Ricky Rizal Wibowo 的刑期从 13 年减至 8 年。另一位警官 Richard Eliezer Pudihang Lumiu 在初审中被判处 18 个月徒刑，并于 8 月 4 日假释。

;

;Sambo 的案件发生在印度尼西亚警察部队的艰难时期，该部队已经在印尼警察部队中享有盛誉。腐败、任人唯亲和法外暴力。

;

;去年 10 月桑博案审判开始前，警方在玛琅市坎朱鲁汉体育场向球迷发射催泪瓦斯，造成致命碾压，造成 135 人死亡，其中包括

;

;今年 3 月，两名参与催泪瓦斯事件的警察因疏忽导致受伤和死亡的指控被判无罪，而另一名警察仅被判处 18 个月监禁。澳大利亚默多克大学印度太平洋研究中心研究员雅基·贝克表示，虽然桑博的审判被视为警察问责制的试金石，但它掩盖了坎朱鲁汉体育场的案件在玛琅，数百人在涉及多名警察的碾压中丧生，突显了印度尼西亚军队实施的系统性暴力。

;

;“警方像肥皂剧和好警察案件一样精心策划了桑博的审判贝克说：“死刑减刑可能被视为印度尼西亚警察有罪不罚现象持续存在的进一步迹象，也是印度尼西亚警察部队继续存在有罪不罚现象的进一步迹象。”她补充说，当印度尼西亚警察使用暴力造成致命后果时，缺乏问责制。

;

;“这也只是在坎朱鲁汉受害者的伤口上撒盐，”她说。

;

;印度尼西亚的警察丑闻让佐科威恼火，但警察会被吓倒吗？

;

;目前尚不清楚是什么原因导致 Hutabarat 在 Sambo 的家中被枪杀，尽管审判中的检察官暗示 Hutabarat 与 Sambo 的家有染。妻子。 Sambo 和 Candrawathi 声称 Hutabarat 曾试图对 Candrawathi 进行性侵犯，并在 Sambo 与他对峙时第一个向他开枪。

;

;印度尼西亚国际特赦组织主任乌斯曼·哈米德 (Usman Hamid) 表示，公众对这一问题的看法存在分歧。桑博被判处死刑，但“主流舆论希望看到他被处决”。

;

;但他表示，国际特赦组织支持法官减刑的决定。

;

;“我们同意桑博的行为构成严重犯罪，特别是考虑到他作为内政部长的身份。然而，即使他需要受到严厉的惩罚，我们认为他仍然有生存的权利，”他说。

;

;“国家机器犯下的一切形式的国际法禁止的罪行都必须受到惩罚，但仍然必须公平，不必判处死刑，这是一种过时的惩罚。”

;

;死刑仍然是印度尼西亚法律制度的一部分，适用于一系列犯罪，包括预谋谋杀、贩毒、腐败和恐怖主义。

;Lil Tay，一位年轻的亚洲社交媒体明星，因其脏话视频而走红，已经死了。据多份报道称，她当时 14 岁。

;

;她的家人周三在 Instagram 上分享了一份声明，宣布了这位冉冉升起的说唱歌手的去世消息。

;

;“我们怀着沉重的心情分享这一毁灭性的消息。我们深爱的克莱尔突然悲惨去世的消息，”声明称。

;

;“我们无法用言语来表达难以承受的损失和难以形容的痛苦。这个结果完全出乎我们的意料，让我们所有人都感到震惊。”Instagram 的声明继续说道。 “她哥哥的去世给我们的悲痛增添了难以想象的深度。”

;

;Lil Tay（真名 Claire Hope）在 2018 年因在 Instagram 上发布的炫耀名牌服装和豪华汽车的照片和帖子而走红。在 2018 年 3 月的一段视频中，霍普声称她浴室里的浴缸和马桶“都比你的房租还贵”。

;

;截至周三，这名少女的两部 YouTube 视频 - 一部参观杰克·保罗的家，一部讲述关于她与网络明星说唱歌手 Danielle “Bhad Bhabie” Bregoli 的不和 – 观看次数超过 400 万，她的 Instagram 帐户拥有超过 300 万粉丝。

;

;亚洲儿童说唱歌手 Lil Tay 陷入监护权之争，社交媒体帖子透露

;

;2018 年，这位社交媒体明星吸引了 YouTube 名人杰克·保罗 (Jake Paul)、因菲尔博士 (Dr Phil Phil) 的亮相而走红的布雷戈利 (Bregoli) 和网络名人哇维琪 (Woah Vicky) 的关注。

;

;她的视频也引起了史努比狗狗的注意。但他似乎并不喜欢 Lil Tay 在 2018 年的行为。

;

;“她需要在学校学习如何成为一个小女孩，而不是一个愚蠢的成年人，”他写道互联网明星的视频。

;

;Lil Tay 与家人从加拿大搬到了洛杉矶，她在 2018 年接受《早安美国》节目的 Juju Chang 采访时表示，“没有人强迫我这样做”，而且她母亲 – Angela Tian – 并没有剥削她。

;

;她继续说道：“这是我的决定。我对自己所做的事情感到满意”。

;

;尽管 Lil Tay 在网络上享有盛誉，但 2018 年之后她似乎没有在她的社交媒体帐户上发布更多视频或照片。在她去世之前，这位说唱歌手的最新作品Instagram 帖子是向已故音乐家 XXXTentacion 致敬。

;

;该家族周三发表声明，要求粉丝和社交媒体关注者“在我们对这一巨大损失感到悲痛之际，保护隐私”。声明还表示，这位明星以及她哥哥的死亡“仍在调查中。”

;

;“克莱尔将永远留在我们心中，她的缺席留下了不可替代的空虚，所有人都会感受到谁认识她并爱她，”声明总结道。

; Thu, 10 Aug 2023 07:20:02 +0800 ‘No price war’: Hong Kong developers brush aside fears of a property crash even as CK Asset offers new Kowloon flats at 15 pc discounthttps://www.scmp.com/business/article/3230555/no-price-war-hong-kong-developers-brush-aside-fears-property-crash-even-ck-asset-offers-new-kowloon?utm_source=rss_feed

;;

;CK Asset Holding's aggressive pricing of homes at a development in Kowloon – where prices lower than Hong Kong has seen in seven years have drawn a throng of potential buyers – is not the first shot in a catastrophic price war but simply a smart strategy to clear inventory, experts said.

;

;The developer, the property flagship of Hong Kong billionaire Li Ka-shing, also dismissed claims that its discounted pricing aimed to, or would, trigger a price war.

;

;More than 22,000 prospective buyers have deposited cheques in hopes of buying flats at Coast Line II in Yau Tong, which are priced at HK$14,686 (US$1,880) per square foot on average after discounts. CK Asset expanded the sale, which starts on Saturday, from 254 units to 382 and finally to all 626 available flats given the response.

;

;“Every developer has different strategies to sell their new residential projects, and CK Asset just chose to quickly sell [these units] by offering some discounts, ” said Stewart Leung Chi-kin, chairman of the executive committee of the Real Estate Developers Association of Hong Kong.

;

;The move should not be seen as a dire omen for the market, as the developer is still earning a healthy profit, Leung said. “If a developer decides to sell a property at a reduced price, but they are making a loss, then there would be a need to panic.”

;

;Leung and other experts believe that the aggressive pricing was a marketing strategy to test homebuyers' responses and attract market attention. It is also seen as good business.

;

;“Holding inventories amid a high interest-rate environment is not good for developers in the long run, because [it] means paying extra interest every month,” said Eddie Hui Chi-man, associate head of Polytechnic University's faculty of construction and environment. “If I sell [inventory] at a slower pace, my costs will increase, so it is better to sell faster.”

;

;Li Ka-shing's CK Asset to resume buy-backs to boost share price, analysts say

;

;Some consultants said CK Asset's aggressive discounting will lead other developers to offer bigger discounts for new launches in the third quarter, triggering market speculation about a greater decline in home prices.

;

;“We always price our developments to the then-market situation,” Justin Chiu Kwok-hung, CK Asset's executive director, told the Post, adding that the lower prices will give the younger generation a chance to own their own residences or upgrade their homes.

;

;“Every development has its own calculation,” Chiu said, dismissing concerns that the discounts could lead to a price war among the city's major developers. “It is not a very big development, it will not change the market. It's money from our pocket … so why would I trigger a price war?”

;

;“Every development has its own calculation, [The Coastline] is not a very big development, it will not change the market,” the executive said.

;

;HSBC's exit from London's Canary Wharf seen triggering home-price slide: agency

;

;The pricing level will make “not a lot of profit, but a decent profit”, he added.

;

;The gross margin for the whole project will be about 25 to 30 per cent, which is still a reasonable profit for the company, albeit lower than the 30 to 40 per cent yield from projects over the years, according to Raymond Cheng, managing director of property management at CGS-CIMB Securities.

;

;Low prices at this one project are unlikely to affect the entire market, said Chau Kwong-Wing, chair professor of real estate and construction at the University of Hong Kong.

;

;Country Garden's stocks, bonds tumble after developer misses coupon payments

;

;“What happens later also depends on the next batch, and on CK Asset or other developers' calculations,” he said. “If all developers follow this huge discount, then, of course, the impact on the market would be quite significant, but I don't think that is likely to happen. I think they will observe for a while first.”

;

;Hong Kong's property market has been sluggish as high interest rates weigh on buyer sentiment. Two recent project launches – La Montague in Wong Chuk Hang and High Park I in Yuen Long – received only lukewarm interest.

;

;Meanwhile, the number of unsold units in completed projects is the highest since 2007, according to JLL, which said a total of 83,000 housing units are available in Hong Kong, with 18,000 in completed projects and the rest under construction. About 25,000 more units are expected to hit the market in 2023.

;

;Déjà vu: Shanghai mortgage boycott threat a blow to cash-starved sector

;

;An on-site lottery on Saturday morning at Fortune Metropolis in Hung Hom will decide which of the 22,000 hopefuls get to buy the Coast Line II flats. The expected sale proceeds from the 626 units are HK$4.67 billion.

;

;The cheapest flat at Coast Line II, which lies about 10 minutes from an MTR station in the southeastern corner of Kowloon, is a 210 sq ft studio on offer for HK$2.9 million, or HK$13,810 per sq ft, after an 18 per cent discount.

;;

;A doctor used too much force and decapitated a Georgia woman's baby during delivery, according to a lawsuit that lawyers said was filed on Wednesday.

;

;The baby's mother and father, Jessica Ross and Treveon Isaiah Taylor Snr, attended a news conference in Atlanta where their lawyers announced the lawsuit against Dr Tracey St. Julian and Southern Regional Medical Centre, a hospital in Riverdale, Georgia, where Ross went on July 9 to have her son. Riverdale is about 20km (13 miles) south of Atlanta.

;

;“They were so excited about the birth of their first child,” said lawyer Cory Lynch. “Unfortunately, their dreams and hopes turned into a nightmare that was covered up by Southern Regional Medical Centre.”

;

;Calls to St. Julian's office went unanswered, and an email message was not immediately returned. Associated Press was not able to determine whether she had a lawyer.

;

;Southern Regional said in statements it could not discuss treatment for particular patients due to privacy laws, but it denies the allegations against it. Its “heartfelt thoughts and prayers” were with Ross and Taylor and their care providers, it said.

;

;“Our commitment is to provide compassionate, quality care to every single patient, and this loss is heartbreaking,” the hospital said. It later added that St. Julian was not an employee of the hospital, and it had “taken the appropriate steps in response to this unfortunate situation”.

;

;A spokeswoman, Kimberly Golden-Benner, said the hospital could not elaborate. St. Julian is part of a healthcare group called Premier Women's Obgyn that has two locations and offers circumcisions, infertility treatment and other services in addition to low- and high-risk obstetric care, according to its website.

;

;St. Julian is a board-certified obstetrician and gynaecologist who has been practising in the Atlanta area since January 2005, the website says.

;

;Dead babies found hidden in ceiling of former US funeral home

;

;According to the suit, the baby got stuck during delivery, but St. Julian delayed a surgical procedure and failed to seek help quickly. Instead, she applied “ridiculously excessive force” on the baby's head and neck to try to deliver it, lawyer Roderick Edmond, who is also a doctor, said.

;

;Roughly three hours passed before St. Julian took Ross, 20, for a caesarean section, according to the suit. By then, a fetal monitor had stopped registering a heartbeat.

;

;The caesarean section removed the baby's legs and body, but the head was delivered vaginally, according to Edmond.

;

;The couple asked for a C-section earlier, when the baby still could have survived, but were denied, Edmond said.

;

;He said the case highlighted the higher rates of infant and maternal mortality for black women.

;

;Ross and Taylor, 21, did not speak at Wednesday's news conference.

;

;Their lawyers also accused Southern Regional staff of trying to cover up the decapitation by discouraging the couple from getting an autopsy, encouraging them to have their son cremated and wrapping and propping his body to make it appear the head was still attached.

;

;The suit alleges gross negligence, fraud and intentional infliction of emotional distress. It seeks unspecified punitive damages.
